data.title: An average night
data.text: My wife and I met a friend there and we ordered.  I ordered a power drink and my wife got a hot chocolate. It took over 10 minutes to get our drinks. Our friend had her meal right away.  There was no way it should have taken as long at it did.  I hope it doesn't happen again. We like the food and will be back again next month.

data.title: Disappointed of deleting a menu item
data.text:
I would go to Panera bread in Coco Plum Plaza in North Port 3 times a week.  I usually went through the drive thru.

Most every time I went they were out of Blueberry Scones.  Didn't matter what time of day, cause I never went at the same time.  They never asked me at the drive thru if I wanted bread or chips.  After going inside and ordering a few times, I asked about that.  They told me yes I have that option through the drive thru and someone should have asked.  I don't eat bread so would rather have chips.  I had so much bread accumulated in my freezer from there because I don't eat it and didn't want to throw it away.

The last time I went inside to order and when I went to order my usual, which is Black Bean Soup and a Blueberry Scone, I stood in line for 10 minutes to find out that they discontinued the Black Bean Soup.  I was extremely disappointed and not happy since I had to wait in line that long to find out.  There was only one person in front of me, but it took the cashier that long to wait on her.

The cashier asked the manager to make sure and she said yes it was gone.  I told her that was the only reason I went in there and that I wouldn't be back.

Very disappointed.  Haven't been back since.

data.title: Best bagels
data.text: The people are friendly, the atmosphere is nice. Very easy to get to right off main road. There is a drive through & you can also order ahead on line. There are outside tables with umbrellas, so you can linger & enjoy the Beautiful Florida weathet. Paneras has the best bagels, they also sell bread, muffins & a fruit ring. Soup, salads& sandwiches. They open early & close late.

data.title: I love our Panera!
data.text: Out of all the Panera's I've been to in sarasota county this one is absolutely the BEST! Great, friendly staff. Excellent service. Love the food and the fact that Panera is trying to keep their food clean and more on the healthier side compared to other fast food place. If you want good sandwich and salad or soup on the go then this would be it.

data.title: Great people
data.text: My dad eats here every morning and the people are always so nice to him.  Good value for him. Very dependable, you know you'll get a good meal at a good price with a smile.

data.title: Average
data.text: It was small portions the price expensive. It was clean and had a Subway  restaurant feel  to it. The tea was excellent. Not a place I would come to often.

data.title: Very expensive and quality of food not great
data.text: I have found this restaurant to be very expensive - I had to send my sandwich back  two times before they got it right- salad was not impressive food was medicore

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Went online to order via cellphone and everyone easily selected their meal; hubby picked up and brought home and was a wonderful easy dinner after day at beach! Yum! Got sliced cinnamon bread for next day breakfast.

data.title: Too pricey
data.text: They have good food but their prices are a bit over the top. Small dining room and you order from the counter then the food is brought to your table.

data.title: Another good lunch
data.text: Always enjoy Panera Bread for the fresh food.  Usually have a sandwich, but chose the salad this time and it was really good.

data.title: lunch with friends
data.text: Always fresh and tasty.  The service is fast, so, if you are on lunch break it is a safe place to go.  Never disappointed.

data.title: Great food!!
data.text: Wish they were abit cheaper, high priced for what you get but great food regardless!! I wish their prices were better, I would definitely eat there alot more often!! I do love the broccoli cheese soup and their baked goods are great too. Definitely check this place out, they are all over the U.S..

data.title: Nice Outdoor Seating
data.text:
Not all Panera Bread restaurants are designed the same but the one in North Port is fairly new and we really like the outdoor seating available with staff bringing the orders right to your table.

The outdoor space is open enough to enjoy the day without being noisy from traffic at this busy mall.

As always, the food is fresh and they use quality ingredients, setting a standard for the industry.

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Shopping in North Port we then stopped 
for lunch we both had Tuna fish which was
ok they were kind of small I said no 
tomatoes however they put them on them
anyway I didn't send back just took them
off I will go back because we like their 
Panini's .

data.title: Screwed up my drink three separate times
data.text: Gave this place three tries.  The staff wasn't very friendly and my drink was yucky three times.  Iced coffee and iced chai tea are not complicated.  Plus I had to wipe the cup off because it was a mess. My sandwich has almost nothing on it and it looked like it was thrown together.  I had to ask if the items in the window were mine because no one said anything.  Staff talk to eachother instead of working.  Almost forgot the cream was out,  in the morning no less. Three terrible experiences.

data.title: Modern, bright and cozy
data.text: Cozy atmosphere. Great coffee and delicious but limited choices in sandwiches. Staff was friendly and seating comfortable

data.title: great food for a quick bite or just hanging out
data.text: I do go to this location more than most of the others because of the convenience of a drive through. Sometimes I just pick up a coffee or a chai latte. Most times I order on line and go to the quick pick up area inside. This comes in most handy when going from work during my lunch break. I order and pay on line. I let my coworkers know that I am going and they do the same. I go down to the restaurant and just pick up everyone's orders...no messing with change etc....the food is great as light and as hearty as you would want. It is a little pricey for me so I don't go as much as I would like to.

data.title: Hmmmm....not exactly what I expected from Panera
data.text: I ordered take-home sandwiches.  On the bright side my order was ready quickly.  The turkey on my turkery/cheddar/apple sandwich tasted like Thanksgiving leftovers (that's a compliment!) But when I first unwrapped mine, it looked like it had been slapped together - bread was haphazardly placed, turkey was lumped onto the bread...was not the usual quality I've come to expect from Panera.  It was just a ho-hum sandwich.  And I wish when bread is advertised as "whole grain" I could depend on the label showing all whole grain and not including some white flour.  As a diabetic, whole grains are important!  Panera, you disappointed me tonight. I'll be back.....but not to North Port because I suspect that might have a limited menu compared to other Paneras.

data.title: Need a little more variety on sandwiches
data.text: First time visit to a Panera Bread and although my baked potato soup was delicious I had a hard time coming up with a sandwich to go along with my Pick 2. I picked tuna but really didn't care of it and none of the others were to my liking. Husband loved their pecan rolls just wish they had a little bigger selection on sandwiches.

data.title: Salad heaven
data.text: I love the salads you can chose from here. Most of them come with some kind of protein, chicken, and are tasty. I love their pumpkin muffie! They are always packed, especially when the snowbirds are flocking around. So be prepared to see a crowd.
